citation.article-title: Martelella mediterranea gen. nov., sp. nov., a novel alpha-proteobacterium isolated from a subterranean saline lake
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Martelella (Mar.tel′ell.a. N.L. fem. dim. n. Martelella in honour of the French explorer E. Martel, who, in 1896, discovered Lake Martel inside the caves of Drach in Mallorca, the site where this micro-organism was isolated).
Cells are Gram-negative, non-spore-forming short rods.
Phylogenetically related to members of the order ‘Rhizobiales’.
The only respiratory lipoquinones present are ubiquinones, Q-10 predominating.
The most abundant fatty acids are C19 : 0 cycloω8c, C18 : 1ω7c, C16 : 0 and 11-methyl C18 : 1ω7c.
The other minor fatty acids are C18 : 0, 10-methyl C19 : 0, C20 : 2ω6,9c, C18 : 0 3-OH and C16 : 0 3-OH.
The DNA G+C content of the type species is 57·4 mol%.
The type species of the genus is Martelella mediterranea.
